page.title: 19Event,Wick
page.content: In June 1985 Wick Railway Station was reopened after being modernised.When the special train entered the station Mr.John Young, Convener of the Caithness District Council,named it "Caithness." Many British Rail officials travelled north for the occasion. Lady Jessamine Harmsworth unveiled a plaque to commemorate the updated station.A mural designed by Wick Brownies and Guides welcomes visitors to Wick and shows places of interest such as Girnigoe Castle,Wick Harbour,John O'Groats and Caithness Glass. Our class,Primary 7A Pulteneytown Academy,went to the opening so that we could record this latest event in Wick for the Domesday Book.
